category.name: Family Prayers
category.description: Prayers for family devotion and spiritual growth

content.text:
God, You are ultimate and holy, yet gentle and humble.
You have brought me to this valley, a place where I can truly see.
Here, I'm living in the low places, but I see You in the high places.
Trapped by my own mistakes, I can still see Your greatness.

Let me learn from this irony:
That the way down is actually the way up.
That being humble is how to be lifted high.
That a broken heart is the one that gets healed.
That a truly sorry spirit is the one that can celebrate.
That the soul that turns back is the one that wins.
That having nothing is how I get everything.
That carrying my burdens is how I find my strength.
That giving is how I receive.
That this valley is the place where I can see clearly.

God, they say that even in the daytime, you can see stars from the bottom of a well,
and the deeper the well, the brighter Your stars shine.
Let me find Your light in my own darkness,
Your life when I feel empty,
Your joy in my sadness,
Your grace in my mess-ups,
Your true worth in my struggles,
Your hope right here in this valley.
